## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been doing some research on Verus and I had a few questions. What was the main motivation behind Verus' Initial Coin Offering (ICO) in 2018?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, Verus didn't have an Initial Coin Offering (ICO) in 2018. In fact, Verus had a 100% fair launch with no ICO and no premine, as announced on BCT on May 21, 2018. This decision was made to ensure a fair and transparent launch of the project.

**User:**
That's interesting. When was the Verus Foundation formation announced?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus Foundation formation was announced on July 30, 2018. This marked an important milestone in the development of the Verus ecosystem.

**User:**
I've also been reading about some of the forks that have taken place in the Verus network. What was the outcome of the Sapling fork at block 227520?

**AI Assistant:**
The Sapling fork at block 227520 was a seamless fork to the latest upgrade, which incorporated Sapling and a modified Crypto Conditions "Stake Guard" to solve the nothing-at-stake problem. The fork was a success and helped to further improve the security and functionality of the Verus network.

**User:**
And what about the VerusHash 2.0 Fork at block 310,000? How did that go?

**AI Assistant:**
The VerusHash 2.0 Fork at block 310,000 was an outstanding success and the smoothest fork to date. The upgrade was a significant improvement to the network and demonstrated the ability of the Verus community to come together and implement changes that benefit the project as a whole.
What was the main motivation behind Verus' Initial Coin Offering (ICO) in 2018?
Verus did not have an Initial Coin Offering (ICO) in 2018. In fact, Verus had a 100% fair launch with no ICO and no premine, as announced on BCT on May 21, 2018.

al achievement and community contributor the acknowledgement they deserve.
Following is not an exhaustive list, there are so many updates, improvements, and lots of little things along the way including coin listings, it would be ridiculously long! But I drew out what I felt are the big highlights. Many of these highlights included more than a single community member or developer. To learn more about each you can peruse the Verus discord Announcements channel.
Some highlights from 2018:
May 21–100% fair launch (no ico/no premine) announced on BCT
June 12 — FAQ Bounty Offerings Announced to community
June 13 — Vision Paper, White Paper Phase I, new website, Twitter, Reddit… all released
July 7 — Listing on Digital Price, first exchange listing
July 30 — Announcement of Verus Foundation formation
Aug 14 — First community member operated pools online
Sep 9 — Released electrum servers, Lite mode Agama, and first GPU miners!
Sep 10 — Mobile development underway and announced
Oct 15 — Sapling Update released & fork announced
Oct 30 — Sapling fork at 227520, a seamless fork to latest upgrade which incorporates Sapling and a modified Crypto Conditions “Stake Guard” solving nothing at stake
Nov 15 — Proof of Power paper published, proving Verus PoP consensus’ immunity to 51% hash attacks
Nov 27 — Verus upstreams Sapling modifications and VerusHash 1.0 to Komodo
Dec 13 — AAcoin launches unique exchange-staking pool for VRSC
Dec 20 — VerusHash 2.0 Released with Verus update v0.5.0 and fork date announced. Bounty announced for GPU and FPGA developers for new VerusHash
Dec 28 — VerusHash 2.0 Fork at block 310,000 is an outstanding success and the smoothest fork I’ve ever witnessed
We also thought it would be nice to shout out to all the community members who contributed! There are so many active contributors in the Verus community and I really want to express my personal gratitude
